result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan T. Braker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft by Contractor >$5000 - $10,000 [Modifiers: Penalty - Theft >$5000-$10,000], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 779.02(5).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution is to be paid at a rate of $750.00/mo.   
Restitution of $4969.39 is from case 15CF405 (dismissed but read in). 

**ORDER** 1-25-17 Orally amended by Court restitution is to be paid at a rate of $100.00/mo. until April 1, 2017.  Then it will return to $750.00/mo.
If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.  Costs are to be paid within the first year of probation.

Submit DNA sample.  May not bid or take on any jobs of his own.  Must report to probation by 1:00 pm on 9-29-16.  If paid in full after 1 year, defendant may discharge early from probation. 

**AMENDED** 6-23-17 Court ordered added condition of probation that the defendant shall not have to undergo sex offender evaluation and/or treatment, and shall not be subjected to the extra rules that the DOC places upon sex offenders.

ADA Crystal Long appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared in person pro se.     State filed letters of victims requesting probation review hearing.  Restitution is not being paid.  Has not filed financial disclosure statement due by January 8th.  Found in contempt of court.  Agent stated one payment was made January 9th.  Court questioned why financial disclosure not filed.  Defendant filed disclosure with court -copy to get into both files.  Copy to be provided to victims in both cases.  Victim to contact attorney regarding garnishment.  Defendant explained reason why he is not able to pay.  Agent states probation will be extended before September.  18CM76 initial appearance done.   1:00 pm/1:15pm

Defendant Ryan T. Braker in court with attorney Steven James Sarbacker.  Crystal N Long appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 14CF291, 15CF405, and 14CF441.  Rights/Elements.  In 14CF441 defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  14CF291 Dismissed.  15CF405 Dismissed but read in for restitution.  In 14CF441 Court withheld sentencing placed defendant on probation for 2 years.  Conditions of probation include: $518.00 costs to be paid in first year.  Submit DNA sample.  Restitution $10845.18 and in 15CF405 Restitution $4969.39.  Defendant is to pay $750.00 per month in restitution.  If paid in full after 1 year, defendant may discharge early from probation.  May not bid or take on any jobs on his own.  Must report by 1 pm today to probation.  No jail credit.
Defendant may leave the State of Wis. on 8/19/16 to attend a wedding in Michigan and return to Wis. on 8-21-16
